_header: At Trumpington not far fro Cantebridge
_description: Geoffrey Chaucer, the Reeve’s Tale of the Canterbury Tales — 404 lines in couplets.

BodArcSelB14.First Lines:
AT Trumpynton nought fer fro Cambriggether goth a broke & ouer
                    that a brigge…
BodArcSelB14.Last Lines:
…saue al this companye grete & smalethus haue I quytte the
                    Miller in my tale
BodArcSelB14.Attributed Title:
…And next folwith / his tale of the Millere and his wiff how thei
                    were bigiled (f. 58); the Reve (RT); Here endith the Reve his tale… (f.
                    64)

BodBar20.First Lines:
At Trumpyngton nouȝt fer fro Canterburyther gooth a broke and
                    ouer þat a brige…
BodBar20.Last Lines:
…Saue all þis companye grete and smaleThus haue I quyte
                    þe Miller in my tale
BodBar20.Attributed Title:
…and here begynneth þe tale (f. 44); The Reve (RT); here endith
                    þe Reves tale… (f. 49v)

Bod414.First Lines:
[A]T Trumpington not ferre from CambriggeTher goth a broke and ouer
                    that a brigge…
Bod414.Last Lines:
…Saue al this cumpany gret & smaleThus haue I quitte the
                    Milners tale

Bod686.First Lines:
At Trompyngton nat ferre fro cantebriggeTher goth a brok and over
                    þat a brygge…
Bod686.Last Lines:
…Save al þis company grete and smaleThus have y quyt
                    þe Miller in my tale
Bod686.Attributed Title:
Here begynneth the Reues tale (f. 49); Reue (RT); Here endeth the Reues
                    tale… (f. 54)

BodHatDon1.First Lines:
At Trumpingtoun not fer fro Canterbriggeþere goth a broke and
                    ouer þat a brigge…
BodHatDon1.Last Lines:
…Saue al þis compani grete and smaleThus haue I quite
                    þe millers tale
BodHatDon1.Attributed Title:
…And next / beginneth þe Carpenters tale of þe Miller of
                    Trumpyngdoun (f. 45v); The Carpenters tale (RT); Here endeth þe
                    Carpenters tale of þe Miller of Trympingdoun… (f.
                    50v)

BodLauMis600.First Lines:
…This long night ther tides men no resteBut yett in force al
                    shal be for þe best…
BodLauMis600.Last Lines:
…Saue all þis companye grete and smaleThus haue I quyt
                    þe Meller in my tale

BodLauMis739.First Lines:

                    that bryge…
BodLauMis739.Last Lines:
…Saue all this cumpany grete & smaleThus haue I quyt the
                    myller my tale

BodRawPoe149.First Lines:
…Nowe may I sey þat I am but an Apeyet hath my felowe
                    sum what for his harme…
BodRawPoe149.Last Lines:
…Saue alle this Cumpany grete & smaleThus haue I quitte
                    the Millers tale

BodRawPoe223.First Lines:
At trompington nat fer fro cambriggeTher goth a brook and ouer that
                    a brigge…
BodRawPoe223.Last Lines:

                    mageste…

…And here beginneth his tale folwing (f. 55); The Reues tale
                    (RT)

                    hire wolde he goo…

                    lawe þat seith þus…

BLHar7333.First Lines:
At Thorpyngton not fer from Caumb[ugge?]Þer
                    gooþe a brooke & ouer þat a brugge…
BLHar7333.Last Lines:
…Save alle þis companye her gret & smaleThus have I
                    qwite þe milner his tale
BLHar7333.Note:
I.4115 omitted; 3055, 4136 inserted in margin; 4159-60 reversed;
                    spurious line follows 4116.
BLHar7333.Attributed Title:
…and / nowe begynnythe here nexste þe Revis tale (f.
                        57vb)

Holkham667.First Lines:
Atte trumpington nat fer from cambriggeTher goth a broke and ouere
                    that a brigge…
Holkham667.Last Lines:
…Save all this companye grete and smaleThus haue I quyt the
                    miller in my tale
Holkham667.Note:
I.4250 omitted; 4047-8, 4269-7 reversed; spurious line follows 4246. The
                    leaf containing the end of Reeve’s Tale and the beginning of the
                        Second Nun’s Prologue (comprising ff. 2+7 of Quire 4) is
                    inverted, with f. 22 consequently following f. 16.

At Trumpington not ferre fro CambriggeTher goth a brook and ouer
                    that a Brigge…
Bodmer48.Last Lines:
…Save all this cumpany gret & smaleThus haue I quitte the
                    mylneres tale
Bodmer48.Attributed Title: Now begynneth the Reves tale (rubric, f. 51)
